identified-content.person: FARLEY, MARY ELLEN CRINNION (MARY ELLEN CRINNION TOGMAN)

block.p: Mary Ellen Crinnion Farley, a daughter of Ellen Farley and P. Robert Farley of West Caldwell, N.J., was married last evening to Dr. Jeffrey Michael Togman, a son of Barbara Togman Anderson of Coral Springs, Fla., and the late Harold Togman. Jean Sommerville Kotkin, a leader of the Ethical Culture Society, officiated at Studio 450 in New York.

Mrs. Togman, 33, is a sportswear designer for Eileen Fisher, the clothing manufacturer, in Irvington, N.Y. She graduated from Smith College. Her father retired as the executive vice president and general manager of the Magazine Publishers of America, a trade association in New York. Her mother is a consumer service representative in East Hanover, N.J., with Nabisco.

Mary Ellen Crinnion Farley, a daughter of Ellen Farley and P. Robert Farley of West Caldwell, N.J., was married last evening to Dr. Jeffrey Michael Togman, a son of Barbara Togman Anderson of Coral Springs, Fla., and the late Harold Togman. Jean Sommerville Kotkin, a leader of the Ethical Culture Society, officiated at Studio 450 in New York.

Mrs. Togman, 33, is a sportswear designer for Eileen Fisher, the clothing manufacturer, in Irvington, N.Y. She graduated from Smith College. Her father retired as the executive vice president and general manager of the Magazine Publishers of America, a trade association in New York. Her mother is a consumer service representative in East Hanover, N.J., with Nabisco.

Dr. Togman, also 33, is a professor of political science at Seton Hall University in South Orange, N.J. He graduated from the State University at Albany and received a doctorate in politics from New York University. His mother is an administrative assistant for the All Broward Hurricane Panel company, a manufacturer of storm protection products in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. His father retired as a teacher of English and drama at Park West High School in New York. The bridegroom is the stepson of Robert Anderson.
